metadata.synopsis: Karlach meets Lann at MOO and he offers her three soul coins as long as she hears the stories of their souls.
metadata.how_to_trigger: 1. Recruit Karlach as companion.2. Speak with Lann as Karlach with no one around.OR1. Recruit Karlach as avatar.2. Speak with Lann with her.

68.speaker: Lann Tarv
68.text: Well. Flo didn't tell a lie. She said you'd find me, and here you are. Karlach, isn't it?

87.speaker: Narrator
87.text: *Memories flood back of a cambion named Florenta you knew in the Hells. The closest thing you had to a friend.*

15.speaker: Lann Tarv
15.text: Didn't think to quiz her about her business.
15.context: NodeContext: Laden with sarcasm; of course he isn't going to quiz a cambion.

80.speaker: Lann Tarv
80.text: She came dressed as a novice. Gave me three soul coins. Said I could sell 'em if I wanted, but if I kept 'em for you, she'd consider it a favour owed.

40.speaker: Karlach
40.text: Let's have the soul coins, then.

91.speaker: Lann Tarv
91.text: 'Fraid they're all gone. Should've come around sooner.

83.speaker: Lann Tarv
83.text: You can take a look at my other wares, if you like. Won't entice Flo into my debt, but I'm always looking for wielders worthy of my stock.

52.speaker: Karlach
52.text: Did Flo have anything else for me?

3.speaker: Lann Tarv
3.text: A shit-eating grin. Oh, and uh. This. That's it.

106.speaker: Lann Tarv
106.text: Sure. But she did have a condition.
106.context: NodeContext: A condition before Karlach can have the soul coins

54.speaker: Lann Tarv
54.text: For every coin you take, you've got to hear the story of the soul trapped inside.

23.speaker: Karlach
23.text: Fine. Get on with it, then.

10.speaker: Lann Tarv
10.text: First coin's got the soul of a woman named Mavery.
10.context: NodeContext: MAH- vur-ee. Only here so pronounce it however you want.

43.speaker: Lann Tarv
43.text: She was born to a cruel mother and a violent father and three evil brothers, all named Baldur.

73.speaker: Lann Tarv
73.text: She never knew a day of love in all her life. When she was a girl of fifteen, she sold her soul to Tiamat in exchange for someone who would love her unconditionally.

37.speaker: Lann Tarv
37.text: She got what she asked for. A fellow named Clint, destined to be her soul mate. Struck by a cart and died a few moments after clapping eyes on our Mavery. Poor guy.

17.speaker: Lann Tarv
17.text: The scud of her soul is yours, now.

7.speaker: Karlach
7.text: Thanks. I'll put it to better use than Tiamat would have.

51.speaker: Lann Tarv
51.text: This'n has got the soul of a man named Frakes. Lived in a village near Neverwinter, hit hard by the worst hunger in a thousand years.

78.speaker: Lann Tarv
78.text: Frakes called out for help - prayed for his children to have meat to eat.

63.speaker: Lann Tarv
63.text: Zariel answered. Made old Frakes grow flesh upon flesh after flesh. His wee ones had all the meat they could stomach.

108.speaker: Karlach
108.text: I'll put his coin to good use. He'll help me rid the Realms of people like Zariel.

49.speaker: Lann Tarv
49.text: Whatever you need to tell yourself, woman.

0.speaker: Lann Tarv
0.text: I'd tell you another, but I'm afraid those are the only coins I've got for you. You should've come around sooner while I still had all three.

79.speaker: Lann Tarv
79.text: Last one's got the soul of a little boy named Ongir. Eight years old. He liked playing in the sun with his friends. That's all I know.
79.context: NodeContext: ON-geer but it's a one-off so do it your way

14.speaker: Karlach
14.text: Thanks, Flo. Hearing all these stories has ruined my day, which I suppose was the point.

88.speaker: Lann Tarv
88.text: You got three soul coins out of the bargain, didn't you? I'd quit whinging if I were you.

110.speaker: Lann Tarv
110.text: I did my part. That means our business is done, unless you've got actual gold to hand.

9.speaker: Lann Tarv
9.text: That's it. Oh. And this slip of scratch. And now we're done.

36.speaker: Lann Tarv
36.text: That cambion friend of yours went through a lot of trouble to get you them coins.

74.speaker: Karlach
74.text: That's absolutely vile. Unsurprising of Zariel, but vile all the same.

11.speaker: Lann Tarv
11.text: You're the one set to consume his soul, I hear.
11.context: NodeContext: A little accusatory, emphasis on 'youre'

69.speaker: Lann Tarv
69.text: I'd tell you another, but I'm afraid that's the only coin I've got for you. You should've come around sooner while I still had all three.

111.speaker: Karlach
111.text: Flo is such a rotten arsehole.

116.speaker: Lann Tarv
116.text: That's between you and her. Do you want the coins or not?

95.speaker: Lann Tarv
95.text: Didn't need to. Your one Flo did some devil woo-woo and stuck 'em in my head. Couldn't forget now if I wanted to.

96.speaker: Karlach
96.text: No - I'm not playing her little game.

100.speaker: Lann Tarv
100.text: She said you might say that. And she said to let you have it your own way.

28.speaker: Lann Tarv
28.text: You can take a look at the rest of my lot, if you like. Got good weapons in search of a worthy wielder.

19.speaker: Karlach
19.text: Now why would she do a thing like that?

35.speaker: Lann Tarv
35.text: You know what devilfolk are like. No point trying to guess at why they do anything.

94.speaker: Karlach
94.text: I'm not falling for one of her little games. No thanks.

13.speaker: Karlach
13.text: What'd she tell you about me?

58.speaker: Lann Tarv
58.text: Told me to look out for a one-horned tiefling with an infernal engine blazing out of her chest.

57.speaker: Lann Tarv
57.text: Then she handed me three soul coins. Said I could sell 'em if I wanted, but if I kept 'em for you, she'd consider it a favour owed.

56.speaker: Karlach
56.text: I don't want to hear another word about her or any other devil.

55.speaker: Lann Tarv
55.text: Suit yourself. Then you won't want to know what she left you.

29.speaker: Karlach
29.text: Whatever it is will be laden with strings attached. No thanks.

67.speaker: Karlach
67.text: Ugh. Go on, then. What is it?

93.speaker: Lann Tarv
93.text: She gave me three soul coins. Said I could sell 'em if I wanted, but if I kept 'em for you, she'd consider it a favour owed.

70.speaker: Karlach
70.text: Flo?! What was she doing here?

44.speaker: Karlach
44.text: I'm positive there's a catch here, but... go on. Let's see the coins.

21.speaker: Lann Tarv
21.text: We won't be here much longer. Just waiting for the word to march. Better stock up while you can.

32.speaker: Karlach
32.text: Incredible. Flo must be livid I got out of Avernus. Wants to drag me back to the Hells with a few horror stories. All right. Go ahead.
32.context: NodeContext: With a bit of a sneer. 'Flo' wasn't really her friend. More like Q and Picard.

30.speaker: Karlach
30.text: Thanks. I'll put it to better use than Tiamat would have.

2.speaker: Karlach
2.text: That's absolutely vile. Unsurprising of Zariel, but vile all the same.
